name: Metformin
usualDose: Typically 1–2 g/day in divided doses (max 2–3 g/day depending on prep).

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 60 mL/min/1.73 m²
renalBands.details: Usual dosing with annual renal monitoring and checks before contrast/surgery.

renalBands.label: eGFR 45–59 mL/min/1.73 m²
renalBands.details: Standard doses often fine; increase monitoring frequency and avoid starting in very high-risk patients.

renalBands.label: eGFR 30–44 mL/min/1.73 m²
renalBands.details: Reduce total daily dose (e.g. ~50%) and monitor 3-monthly. Stop during acute illness or dehydration.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 30 mL/min/1.73 m²
renalBands.details: Avoid metformin due to lactic acidosis risk; use alternative glucose-lowering strategy.

notes: Stop temporarily for sepsis, dehydration, hypoxia, contrast and major surgery.

name: Gliclazide
usualDose: 40–320 mg/day in 1–2 doses (MR usually once daily).

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 60
renalBands.details: Use usual titration; monitor for hypoglycaemia.

renalBands.label: eGFR 30–59
renalBands.details: Lower starting dose and cautious titration; increased risk of prolonged hypos.

renalBands.label: eGFR 15–29
renalBands.details: Prefer alternatives; if used, very low doses with close monitoring.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 15
renalBands.details: Avoid because of significant hypoglycaemia risk.

notes: Warn about driving and hypos, especially as renal function declines.

name: Basal insulin (e.g. insulin glargine)
usualDose: Once or twice daily, fully individualised by glucose profile.

renalBands.label: All eGFR ranges
renalBands.details: No fixed renal table; insulin requirements usually fall as eGFR declines. Use glucose readings to titrate.

notes: Hypoglycaemia risk rises in CKD; review total insulin dose regularly.

name: Empagliflozin
usualDose: 10–25 mg once daily depending on indication.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 60
renalBands.details: Usual doses for T2DM/HF/CKD as per SPC.

renalBands.label: eGFR 20–59
renalBands.details: For HF/CKD, can often continue or initiate down to eGFR ~20; glucose-lowering effect reduced.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 20
renalBands.details: Often avoid initiating; continuing therapy requires specialist/label-based decision.

notes: Follow SPC and local HF/CKD guidance for exact eGFR cut-offs.

name: Dapagliflozin
usualDose: 10 mg once daily.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 60
renalBands.details: Use per SPC for T2DM/HF/CKD.

renalBands.label: eGFR 15–59
renalBands.details: For HF/CKD indications can often be used down to eGFR ~15; minimal glycaemic effect at lower eGFR.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 15
renalBands.details: Usually avoid; refer to SPC and renal/cardiology advice.

notes: Monitor for genital infections, volume depletion and DKA risk.

name: Ramipril
usualDose: 2.5–10 mg once daily depending on indication.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 60
renalBands.details: Titrate to target with creatinine/potassium checks.

renalBands.label: eGFR 30–59
renalBands.details: Start at low dose and titrate cautiously; stop/tweak if creatinine rises >~30% or K⁺ increases.

renalBands.label: eGFR 15–29
renalBands.details: Very low doses with frequent monitoring; consider nephrology/cardiology advice.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 15
renalBands.details: Use only on specialist advice.

notes: Apply sick-day rules – hold during dehydration/AKI risk.

name: Lisinopril
usualDose: 5–40 mg once daily depending on indication.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 60
renalBands.details: Use usual titration with monitoring.

renalBands.label: eGFR 30–59
renalBands.details: Start at low dose and titrate slowly with U&E checks.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 30
renalBands.details: Low-dose use only with close monitoring and often specialist input.

notes: Monitoring strategy similar to ramipril.

name: Losartan
usualDose: 25–100 mg once daily.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 60
renalBands.details: Usual doses with U&E monitoring.

renalBands.label: eGFR 30–59
renalBands.details: Start at 25–50 mg and titrate slowly.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 30
renalBands.details: Low doses only with frequent monitoring or specialist advice.

notes: ARB monitoring and cautions similar to ACE inhibitors.

name: Candesartan
usualDose: 4–32 mg once daily, indication-dependent.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 60
renalBands.details: Use usual titration with renal and potassium checks.

renalBands.label: eGFR 30–59
renalBands.details: Use lower starting doses and titrate carefully.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 30
renalBands.details: Low-dose use only with frequent U&E monitoring / specialist advice.

notes: Commonly used in HF; follow local HF titration protocol if available.

name: Bisoprolol
usualDose: Heart failure: 1.25–10 mg once daily.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 60
renalBands.details: Titrate per HF/HTN protocol.

renalBands.label: eGFR 30–59
renalBands.details: Usually no structured dose change, but titrate slowly in frail/CKD.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 30
renalBands.details: Monitor closely for bradycardia/hypotension; specialist advice in advanced CKD.

notes: Partly renally cleared; accumulation may contribute to bradycardia in CKD.

name: Furosemide
usualDose: 20–80 mg once or twice daily; higher doses in CKD.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 60
renalBands.details: Use lowest effective dose with monitoring of U&E and volume status.

renalBands.label: eGFR 30–59
renalBands.details: May need higher doses; monitor for AKI and electrolyte disturbance.

renalBands.label: eGFR 15–29
renalBands.details: High doses and/or IV often required; usually titrated by HF/renal teams.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 15 / dialysis
renalBands.details: Use only with specialist guidance.

notes: Avoid over-diuresis; assess weight, JVP, BP and renal function.

name: Spironolactone
usualDose: HF: typically 25–50 mg once daily.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 60
renalBands.details: Use usual HF doses with U&E monitoring.

renalBands.label: eGFR 45–59
renalBands.details: Consider 25 mg on alternate days and closer K⁺ monitoring.

renalBands.label: eGFR 30–44
renalBands.details: Often avoid or use very low doses with frequent U&E.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 30
renalBands.details: Usually avoided outside specialist settings.

notes: Stop or reduce if K⁺ rises or creatinine increases significantly.

name: Atorvastatin
usualDose: 10–80 mg once daily.

renalBands.label: All eGFR ranges
renalBands.details: Generally no structured dose change; use usual CKD dose recommendations (often 20 mg+ for secondary prevention).

notes: Monitor for myopathy; adjust if CK or symptoms problematic.

name: Simvastatin
usualDose: 10–40 mg once daily in the evening.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 60
renalBands.details: Usual doses with routine monitoring.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 60
renalBands.details: Often no formal adjustment, but some guidance suggests lower starting doses in advanced CKD.

notes: Be aware of drug interactions and myopathy risk.

name: Apixaban
usualDose: AF: 5 mg twice daily, or 2.5 mg twice daily if dose-reduction criteria.

renalBands.label: CrCl ≥ 50
renalBands.details: Use labelled dose for indication.

renalBands.label: CrCl 30–49
renalBands.details: Often reduced dose in AF if criteria met; check SPC/SPS/local DOAC protocol.

renalBands.label: CrCl 15–29
renalBands.details: AF: usually 2.5 mg bd with caution; VTE often specialist-only decision.

renalBands.label: CrCl < 15 / dialysis
renalBands.details: Most UK guidance: avoid DOACs and consider warfarin or no anticoagulation.

notes: Always use Cockcroft–Gault CrCl, not eGFR, for DOAC dosing.

name: Rivaroxaban
usualDose: AF: 20 mg od with food; 15 mg od if CrCl 15–49.

renalBands.label: CrCl ≥ 50
renalBands.details: Use labelled dose for AF/VTE.

renalBands.label: CrCl 15–49
renalBands.details: AF: 15 mg od; check SPC and SPS for other indications.

renalBands.label: CrCl < 15
renalBands.details: Avoid rivaroxaban; consider alternatives.

notes: Assess bleeding risk and renal function regularly.

name: Edoxaban
usualDose: AF: 60 mg od; 30 mg od if CrCl 15–50, low weight or certain interactions.

renalBands.label: CrCl 50–95
renalBands.details: Use 60 mg od if other reduction criteria not met.

renalBands.label: CrCl 15–49
renalBands.details: Usually 30 mg od; check SPC.

renalBands.label: CrCl < 15
renalBands.details: Avoid edoxaban; use alternative.

notes: Avoid if CrCl > 95 mL/min in AF due to reduced efficacy.

name: Warfarin
usualDose: Highly individualised to INR.

renalBands.label: All eGFR ranges
renalBands.details: No fixed renal adjustment; dose to INR within target range.

notes: Bleeding risk higher in CKD; monitor INR and interactions closely.

name: Gabapentin
usualDose: 900–3600 mg/day in 3 doses in normal renal function.

renalBands.label: CrCl ≥ 60
renalBands.details: Usual titration up to local max.

renalBands.label: CrCl 30–59
renalBands.details: Reduce total daily dose and/or frequency (e.g. ~600–1800 mg/day).

renalBands.label: CrCl 15–29
renalBands.details: Low doses (e.g. 300–600 mg/day) with slow titration.

renalBands.label: CrCl < 15 / dialysis
renalBands.details: Very low or post-dialysis dosing only.

notes: Accumulation causes sedation/ataxia; use CrCl rather than eGFR if possible.

name: Pregabalin
usualDose: 150–600 mg/day in 2–3 divided doses.

renalBands.label: CrCl ≥ 60
renalBands.details: Use usual titration schedule.

renalBands.label: CrCl 30–59
renalBands.details: Lower maximum daily dose (e.g. up to ~300 mg/day).

renalBands.label: CrCl 15–29
renalBands.details: Substantially reduced doses (e.g. up to ~150 mg/day).

renalBands.label: CrCl < 15 / dialysis
renalBands.details: Very low/post-dialysis dosing only.

notes: Accumulation increases sedation, dizziness and oedema; taper slowly when stopping.

name: Sertraline
usualDose: 50–200 mg once daily.

renalBands.label: All eGFR ranges
renalBands.details: Usually no structured dose change; start low and titrate by response.

notes: Monitor for hyponatraemia, especially in older patients and CKD.

name: Mirtazapine
usualDose: 15–45 mg at night.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 40
renalBands.details: Usual dose range with clinical monitoring.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 40
renalBands.details: Consider lower doses and slower titration; monitor for sedation.

notes: Can cause weight gain and sedation; useful for insomnia/poor appetite.

name: Venlafaxine
usualDose: 75–225 mg/day (immediate or modified-release).

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 60
renalBands.details: Usual dose range as per BNF.

renalBands.label: eGFR 30–59
renalBands.details: Reduce total daily dose (e.g. by ~25–50%) and titrate slowly.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 30
renalBands.details: Use low doses only and monitor closely; consider alternatives in severe CKD.

notes: Monitor BP and withdrawal symptoms on discontinuation.

name: Amitriptyline
usualDose: 10–75 mg at night for pain (higher for depression under specialist care).

renalBands.label: All eGFR ranges
renalBands.details: No formal renal table; start low and titrate by tolerability, particularly in older adults/CKD.

notes: Anticholinergic and cardiac side-effects limit use in frailer CKD patients.

name: Amoxicillin
usualDose: 500 mg tds (higher for severe infection).

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 30
renalBands.details: Usual dose and interval.

renalBands.label: eGFR 10–29
renalBands.details: Reduce frequency (e.g. bd) according to severity and local guidance.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 10 / dialysis
renalBands.details: Lower dose or longer interval; seek renal/microbiology advice in severe infection.

notes: Follow local antimicrobial guidance for indication and exact dosing.

name: Co-amoxiclav
usualDose: 500/125 mg tds or 875/125 mg bd depending on prep.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 30
renalBands.details: Usual dosing per indication.

renalBands.label: eGFR 10–29
renalBands.details: Reduce frequency (e.g. bd) as per BNF/local guidance.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 10 / dialysis
renalBands.details: Consider alternative or further dose/interval reduction with specialist advice.

notes: Monitor LFTs if prolonged course; be aware of cholestatic hepatitis risk.

name: Nitrofurantoin
usualDose: 100 mg MR bd or 50 mg qds for 3–7 days.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 45
renalBands.details: Use for lower UTI only if no upper tract features.

renalBands.label: eGFR 30–44
renalBands.details: Some guidance allows short-course use if benefits outweigh risks; avoid prophylaxis.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 30
renalBands.details: Avoid due to poor urinary levels and higher toxicity risk.

notes: Avoid in suspected pyelonephritis or sepsis.

name: Trimethoprim
usualDose: 200 mg bd for 3–7 days (acute UTI).

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 30
renalBands.details: Usual short course dosing.

renalBands.label: eGFR 15–29
renalBands.details: Reduce total dose or extend interval (e.g. 200 mg od).

renalBands.label: eGFR < 15
renalBands.details: Avoid if possible due to hyperkalaemia and creatinine rise.

notes: Check K⁺ and creatinine if using in patients on ACEI/ARB/spironolactone.

name: Cefalexin
usualDose: 500 mg bd–qds depending on indication.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 50
renalBands.details: Usual dose and frequency.

renalBands.label: eGFR 10–49
renalBands.details: Reduce frequency (e.g. bd) as per BNF/local guidance.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 10
renalBands.details: Low dose or longer interval; seek renal/micro advice in serious infection.

notes: Watch for neurotoxicity at very low eGFR and high doses.

name: Digoxin
usualDose: 62.5–250 micrograms od according to age, renal function and indication.

renalBands.label: eGFR ≥ 60
renalBands.details: Use lower doses in older adults; monitor levels if concern.

renalBands.label: eGFR 30–59
renalBands.details: Often 62.5–125 micrograms od or on alternate days; check levels if possible.

renalBands.label: eGFR 15–29
renalBands.details: Very low doses (e.g. 62.5 micrograms od/alt days); monitor for toxicity.

renalBands.label: eGFR < 15
renalBands.details: Dose only with level monitoring and specialist supervision.

notes: Toxicity risk rises in CKD, hypokalaemia and hypomagnesaemia; review interacting drugs.
